title.narrative: Police Professionalization and Community Policing in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) - Phase V

description.narrative: Since 01 March 2015, the International Organization for Migration (IOM) has been implementing a series of projects on Police Professionalization and Community Policing in Lubumbashi (Haut-Katanga province) and Mbuji Mayi (Kasai Oriental province) in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC). In line with the four previous phases of the project, conducted between 01 March 2015 and 21 September 2021, the fifth phase seeks to improve the capacity and accountability of local police in Lubumbashi and Mbuji Mayi in addressing security concerns in their communities, specifically in the District of Diulu (Mbuji Mayi), and Luwowoshi and Naviundu quarters (Annex District– Lubumbashi). This fifth phase also aims at strengthening efforts towards full ownership of community policing by Government partners. This goal is aligned with the overarching objectives of stabilization of the Government of the DRC and the international community to promote good governance, strengthen the rule of law, reduce conflicts, and increase security for communities and vulnerable populations. The extension of the community policing system is also among the main objectives of the second quinquennial national police reform action plan, adopted in December 2019 by the Congolese National Police, and validated as a priority in the police’s operational plan for 2021-2022.
